titles: Whereas Rory Mac Randall Mac Donnell late of the barony of Dungannon in the county of Tyrone, Owen Doo Mac Donnell of the same, Toole Ballagh Mac Donnell late of Croskevenagh in the barony and county aforesaid, [and 16 others] and their complices had in the counties of Monoghan, Antrim, Downe, Tyrone and Londonderry, and other places appeared in armes against His Majesties authority, and several of them committed murders, burglaries, robberies and stealths, besides divers other out-rages to the terror and annoyance of His Majesties loyall and good subjests ... by the Lord Lieutenant and Council, Jo. Berkeley.
author: Ireland. Lord Lieutenant (1670-1672 : Berkeley)
Berkeley, John, Sir, d. 1678.
publisher: Printed by Benjamin Tooke ... and are to be sold by Mary Crooke ...,
notes: Statement of responsibility transposed from head of title.
"Given at the Council chamber in Dublin, the twentieth ninth day of April 1670"--leaf [2]
Reproduction of original in the Society of Antiquaries Library, London.
